intro: Gibbaeum perviride var. luteoviride, commonly known as the yellow-flowered sandverbena, is a succulent plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, known for its diverse and often strikingly colored flora. The plant features fleshy, cylindrical stems that store water, adapted to arid environments. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with a distinctive tubular shape and prominent stamens. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun exposure for optimal growth.
